intro: Microcodon candolleanus, commonly known as the Candolle's microcodon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
